meanings.definition: A small piece or fragment of something, especially food.
meanings.sent1: I found a carritch of cheese on the kitchen table.
meanings.sent2: She picked up a carritch of bread and fed it to the birds.
meanings.sent3: The mouse nibbled on the carritch of cookie left on the counter.
meanings.sent4: The carritch of sunlight peeking through the curtains brightened the room.
meanings.sent5: He carefully placed the carritch of chocolate on the dessert plate.

meanings.definition: To break or tear into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: Please be gentle with the paper so you don't carritch it.
meanings.sent2: The excited child tried to carritch the wrapping paper off the gift.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally carritched the delicate fabric while sewing.
meanings.sent4: The wind can carritch the leaves off the trees in autumn.
meanings.sent5: She used a hammer to carritch the ice into smaller chunks.

meanings.definition: A small amount or portion of something.
meanings.sent1: He only had a carritch of time to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: She added a carritch of sugar to the recipe for sweetness.
meanings.sent3: The carritch of paint left on the brush was just enough for a touch-up.
meanings.sent4: A carritch of kindness can go a long way in making someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The carritch of laughter in the room made everyone smile.
